abstract: Sets the insets of rows in a list on the specified edges.

declaration.code: nonisolated func listRowInsets(_ edges: Edge.Set = .all, _ length: CGFloat?) -> some View

overview:
## Return Value

A view in which the margins of list sections are set to the specified amount

## Discussion

Use this modifier to change the default insets of list rows on the specified edges.

In the example below, the `Flavor` enumeration provides content for list items. The SwiftUI [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ForEach] structure computes views for each element of the `Flavor` enumeration and extracts the raw value of each of its elements using the resulting text to create each list row item. The `listRowInsets(_:_:)` modifier then changes the leading inset of each row of the list and leaves the default insets on the other edges untouched:



When applying multiple `listRowInsets` modifiers, modifiers with the same edges will override modifiers higher up in the view hierarchy.
title: listRowInsets(_:_:)
